parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate. It discusses totalitarianism, art, and law, using Mussolini and Ceaușescu as historical examples.  While these figures are associated with political parties and actions, the post does not advocate for or against any specific candidate in the current parliamentary elections.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, promoting an event open to the public.  The language and content are designed to attract a broad audience interested in the topics discussed.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The primary objective of the post is to promote an academic event discussing totalitarianism, art, and law. While the event touches upon historical figures associated with political regimes, it does not aim to influence the outcome of the current parliamentary elections. The content is primarily educational and analytical, not persuasive or promotional in the context of the election.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post presents information about an academic event in a journalistic style, providing details about the speakers, the topic, and the event's location. It aims to inform the public about the event, not to sway opinions regarding any particular candidate or party.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post does not express personal opinions; it presents factual information about an academic event.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>944843104206875</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post promotes an academic event discussing totalitarianism, art, and law, using historical examples.  While the topic touches upon political figures, the post itself does not advocate for or against any specific candidate or party in the current parliamentary elections. The content is primarily educational and analytical, not persuasive or promotional in the context of the election. The event's focus is historical analysis, not electoral influence.  Therefore, it does not meet the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>MCC</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
